TopicTitle: Why is Mech jeb's Rendezvous so slow?

Articles.Content: Mechjeb wants to do 2 days of phasing orbits. WHY??
I'd imagine phasing orbits are more fuel-efficient than burning delta-V to avoid them, but I have no hard stats to back that up.

d/v efficiency.

Especially in low orbit, there's a limit to how quickly you can rdv with a target.

Because MechJeb authors would add an editable parameter: Expectation Time Limit.

And would restrict any optimization calculations with this value.

It's no problem to wait 5-10 turns around Kerbin, but it's funny when a ship makes 10 turns around the Kerbol star to save 10% of fuel.

Mine wants to do 25 phasing orbits around eve. it takes AGES!

Mechjeb wants to do 2 days of phasing orbits. WHY??

Because you put yourself into an orbit pretty close in period to your target's orbit, and the closer in period the two orbits are, the longer it's going to take your target to lap you, or vice versa. Resulting in extremely long tomes before both you, and your target are in the position where a Hohmann transfer will take you to your target's orbit at a time when the target's there.
